body: It should be easy to fix, if someone has time ðŸ˜„
I'm not yet very familiar with the workflow for collaboration - how can I take on an issue? I would like to make a pr for that issue? @wxiaoguang

If I remember correctly, the related code is here:  

https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/blob/d725b78824a6e83bc5f6db3c83f742810241d1ee/web_src/js/features/repo-issue-edit.ts#L146-L150


And don't worry, if it's not easy (actually the workflow is not that easy ðŸ˜„ ), I could also fix if I get some time.
Hi! Iâ€™d love to work on this issue. Would it be okay if I gave it a try? @wxiaoguang

> Hi! Iâ€™d love to work on this issue. Would it be okay if I gave it a try?

Welcome! Feel free to take a try.

Dear @wxiaoguang Iâ€™ve pushed a fix for this issue ### Problem When clicking the "Quote reply" button, only a single line break (`\n`) was added after the quoted content. As a result, the user's reply appeared to be part of the quote block when rendered in Markdown. ### Solution I updated the quote insertion logic so that it adds one more line break (`\n`) work like Github This way, the cursor lands on a new line and the user's reply is no longer interpreted as part of the quote. ### Modified code `gitea/web_src/js/features/repo-issue-edit.ts 134~135` ``` if (!contentToQuote) contentToQuote = targetRawToQuote.textContent; const quotedContent = `${contentToQuote.replace(/^/mg, '> ')}\n\n`; <- add one more '\n' ``` Before After I just finished testing. Would it be okay if I opened a PR for this?

> I just finished testing. Would it be okay if I opened a PR for this?

Welcome to do so.

issue.title: Fix: quoted replies incorrectly render user input as part of the quote

repository.name: gitea
repository.description: Git with a cup of tea! Painless self-hosted all-in-one software development service, including Git hosting, code review, team collaboration, package registry and CI/CD

issue.body:
### Problem
When clicking the "Quote reply" button, only a single line break (`\n`) was added after the quoted content.  
As a result, the user's reply appeared to be part of the quote block when rendered in Markdown.  

### Solution
Updated the quote insertion logic so that it adds one more line break (`\n`) work like Github
This way, the cursor lands on a new line and the user's reply is no longer interpreted as part of the quote.

Before

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/928929cd-bd2e-4f84-9b92-af6db6e0be69)

After

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7104eed8-3b17-4146-a781-4542f8e15f0f)

### References

Fixes #34177
